Literacy, Books and Reading Team for Schools: About

Choose from two services:

Self-service

Select and collect your own stock from the Suffolk Libraries collection with a self-service card. Only available for certain elements of the service.

Supported service

Our experienced staff use their specialist knowledge of children’s titles and the curriculum to choose for you. We'll also deliver directly to your school.

Primary schools

Element Overview Price (per annum)
Reading book loans for teachers and classrooms Loans of up to 35 fiction and non-fiction books/resources per class to support reading for pleasure. Large print and dual language available. One story sack per card available for EYFS. Self-service cards: £35 per card per annum
Supported service cards: £70 per card per annum
Classroom loans to support the curriculum A box of up to 20 books to support the teaching of curriculum topics throughout the term. Fully supported service: £50 per box per loan
School Library Loans A loan of up to 150 books to supplement the school library Self-service library card: £150 per annum
Supported service library card: £250 per annum
Artefact Service A box of up to 8 related/themed artefacts to support curriculum topics. Each box has a half-termly loan period. Online catalogue available Fully supported service:
  • Up to 6 boxes: £150
  • Up to 9 boxes: £210
  • Up to 12 boxes: £270
Group or guided reader sets Reading sets for group or guided reading. Each set contains 6 copies of a book to support reading development inside the classroom. Each set is a termly loan. Fully supported service:
  • 5 sets per school: £50
  • 10 sets per school: £100
  • 15 sets per school: £150
Advisory support for school librarians Professional librarian support for your school librarian or library assistant and help to develop the school library
  • 1 day: £200
  • 2 days: £350
  • 3 days: £450
  • Half day option: £120
Advisory support for classroom staff Professional support for classroom teachers for reading for pleasure to enhance literacy, and how to use books to enhance the curriculum
  • 1 day: £200
  • 2 days: £350
  • 3 days: £450
  • Half day option: £120
Books support group for school staff (KS2) Talking Books – A termly group for school staff to meet and discuss new books £20 per session or £50 for 3 sessions (includes loan copies of the books)
CPD Programme Professional termly forum for primary library staff £40 per session or three sessions (covers 1 school year) is £100
Training courses for all primary school staff Will be made available over the year and individually priced. Training brochures will be sent out during the school year
The Bookshop Supported book purchasing with significant discount for your school Self-service purchase: Free if you spend over £500
Supported purchase: Free if you spend over £500 but discount reduced by 10%
Awards and Events The Reading Stars Award to celebrate the best of reading and books in primary schools. Available to purchase from April 2016 and launching at the start of the new school year 2016/17 £120
Author Visits Help with bringing an author into your school and structuring an author event. Can help boost your reading for pleasure work. Can be purchased from September 2015 but not available to use until 2016. £200 plus author’s fee
Book Cafés Promoting new books and reading to your staff, parents and pupils through an after school event with professional staff Free if your schools spends more than £2,000 combined on any service elements
£195 per café event

Secondary schools

Element Overview Price (per annum)
Books for classroom learning A box of up to 20 resources to support classroom learning and the curriculum for KS3 Fully-supported service: £50 per box per loan
School Library Loans A loan of up to 250 books to supplement the school library Self-service library card: £200 per annum
Supported service library card: £350 per annum
Specialist Sixth Form Service Library class card for KS5 teachers to support learning Self-service only: £35 per card per annum
Group reader sets for KS5 courses. Up to six books per set with a termly loan per set Each set: £20
KS3 Reader Sets Reading sets of the same book to support reading development inside the classroom for KS3 students. Termly loan period.
  • 5 sets per school: £50
  • 10 sets per school: £100
  • 15 sets per school: £150
Advisory Support and Consultancy Professional librarian support for the school librarian and library assistant. Help and advice to develop the school library as a key feature of the school
  • 1 day: £250
  • 2 days: £400
  • 3 days: £530
  • Half day option: £140
Practical advice and support from trained library assistants to develop the school library and the stock £150 per day Half day option: £90
How to deliver and embed Information Literacy practice within the school – professional advice and guidance for school staff Standard 3 hour session for a group of staff: £350
CPD Programme Termly County Training Day for library staff. Professional development opportunities which features external experts £160 per session or three sessions (covers 1 school year) is £420
Termly Area Librarian Meetings for secondary school library staff £60 per session or three sessions (covers 1 school year) is £150
The Bookshop Supported book purchasing with significant discount for your school Self-service purchase: Free if you spend over £500
Supported purchase: Free if you spend over £500 but discount reduced by 10%
Awards and Events Book Mastermind competition to celebrate reading for Key Stage 3 pupils £160
Author Visits Help with bringing an author into your school and structuring an author event. Can help boost your reading for pleasure work. Can be purchased from September 2015 but not available to use until 2016. £200 plus author’s fee
